title: Calories in Onigiri
meta_description: Learn calories in onigiri for a standard serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition details with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard plain onigiri (triangular rice ball, ~110g), made with short-grain white rice, lightly salted, wrapped in nori seaweed; no filling.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, rice type, filling, brand, and preparation method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One standard onigiri provides about 180 kcal, mostly from carbohydrates in the rice.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts label format for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in one onigiri?
faqs.a: Approximately 180 kcal for a standard plain onigiri.

faqs.q: What are the main nutrients in onigiri?
faqs.a: Primarily 40g carbs from rice, 3g protein, 1g fat, with low fiber and sugars.

faqs.q: Do fillings affect calories in onigiri?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”salmon adds ~60 kcal, tuna mayo ~100 kcal per onigiri.
Often yes, around 300mg per plain onigiri due to salt in rice and seaweed.

faqs.q: How does onigiri size impact calories?
faqs.a: Larger onigiri (~150g) can reach 250 kcal; smaller ones under 150 kcal.
